CLI argument parsing classes

ParserArgumentDict

class larvaworld.cli.argparser.ParserArgumentDict(parsargs)[source]

Bases: object

Create a dictionary of parser arguments.

This class can be instantiated either by a dictionary of param.Parameters or by a dictionary existing in the registry parameter Database.

add(parser=None)[source]

Add parser arguments to an ArgumentParser.

Parameters:

parser (argparse.ArgumentParser, optional) – The ArgumentParser to add the arguments to.

Returns:

The modified ArgumentParser.

Return type:

argparse.ArgumentParser

classmethod from_dict(d0)[source]

A ParserArgumentDict instance.

Return type:

  • m – The simulation mode.

show_args(nested=True, flat_nested=False, input=False, default=False, run_args=True)[source]

Show parsed arguments.

Parameters:

  • nested – Whether to show arguments as a nested dictionary.

  • flat_nested – Whether to show arguments as a flattened nested dictionary.

  • input – Whether to show input arguments.

  • default – Whether to show default arguments.

  • run_args – Whether to show run arguments.

SingleParserArgument

class larvaworld.cli.argparser.SingleParserArgument(short, key, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: object

Create a single parser argument.

This class is used to populate a parser with arguments and get their values.

Parameters:

  • short (str) – The short argument name.

  • key (str) – The argument key.

  • **kwargs (dict) – Additional keyword arguments.

key

The argument key.

Type:

str

args

A list containing the short and long argument names.

Type:

list of str

kwargs

Additional keyword arguments.

Type:

dict

update_larva_groups

larvaworld.cli.argparser.update_larva_groups(lgs, N=None, mIDs=None, dIDs=None, sample=None)[source]

Modifies the experiment’s configuration larvagroups.

Parameters:

  • lgs (dict) – The existing larvagroups in the experiment configuration.

  • N (int) –

  • mIDs (list) – Overwrite the larva models used in the experiment. If not None, a larva group per model ID will be simulated.

  • dIDs (list) – The displayed IDs of the groups. If None, the model IDs (mIDs) are used.

  • sample – The reference dataset.

Returns:

The experiment’s configuration larvagroups.
